title: Scarlett Johansson: Colin Jost relationship is ‘happy and fulfilling’
text:
Scarlett Johansson gave a rare insight into her relationship with Colin Jost (Picture: NBCUniversal)

Scarlett Johansson usually keeps her personal life out of the limelight, but she trilled fans when she gave a rare insight into her relationship with Colin Jost this week.

The actor, 34, who plays Mavel’s Black Widow, is currently engaged to 37-year-old comedian Colin, and she gushed about their relationship.

‘I’m just in a good, creative phase and I’m in a very happy, fulfilling relationship,’ she told Extra at Elle’s Women In Hollywood event in Beverly Hills on Monday.

She added: ‘And I have a beautiful, very healthy, and inspiring daughter, and things are great.’

Scarlett and Colin rarely speak about their relationship, though they often attend events together, and have been dating since 2017.

The Jojo Rabbit actor was previously married to Ryan Reynolds and also has a daughter, Rose Dorothy Duriac, five, from another marriage to French journalist Romain Duriac.

She added of Rose: ‘I have a beautiful, very healthy, and inspiring daughter, and things are great.

The couple rarely speak about their relationship publicly (Picture: AP)

‘I learn a lot of stuff from her all the time, but they’re mostly factoids about bugs. But kids today are really tuned in. I mean, she’s little, she’s 5, but she’s still innocent and little.

‘[I] have other friends who have kids that are 12, 13, 14, and they’re really politically active and they’re connected to one another in ways that we just didn’t have access to, which is awesome.

‘Because you feel like you’re raising a generation of kids that are socially conscious and it’s an exciting time to be a young person.’

Scarlett is fresh off the promo tour for her new film Jojo Rabbit, in which she plays Rosie Betzler, a single mother who tries to teach her son Jojo (Roman Griffin Davis) about the good in people in Nazi Germany, and hides a Jewish girl in their attic in the middle of World War II.

Jojo discovers the girl in his attic and must confront is blind devotion to his country and his closeness to his imaginary friend, Adolf Hitler.

Scarlett told People of her role: ‘It’s a parent’s job to protect their kids. I think that by not involving Roman’s character in the reality of what’s going on at home… I think I’m basically keeping him alive that way.

‘I’ve never had a child in film before. And then this year, I made two films where suddenly [I had] 10 and 11-year-olds — so I kind of became this insta-parent.’

Jojo Rabbit will be released on Friday, 18 October.
